original_title: Sri Lanka sends 2,000 caretakers to Israel; aims more foreign inflow
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka will send 2,000 caretakers to Israel in a move to boost remittances into the island nation which is struggling to move out of an unprecedented economic crisis after sovereign debt default.
The Israeli Government has assured 2000 job opportunities for female caregivers from Sri Lanka this year.

“We have already started sending the caregivers like one year back, there was a process of sending the caregivers to Israel that was very slow. We only sent a few workers, now we are trying to speed it up a bit,” an official at the Ministry of Foreign Employment told EconomyNext.
“There are some suggestions from the Israeli side and from our side also. We will work together to speed up the process.”
The island nation witnessed a record number of migrant workers leaving the country after the island nation was hit by the economic crisis which led to lack of foreign currency to import essentials.

The remittances, which are the country’s top foreign exchange earner fell from December 2021 most workers sought to send money via illegal hawala and undiyal methods in the face of the central bank kept the rupee propped up artificially.
The remittances fell 31 percent for the whole 2022 to $3,786.5 million from the previous year’s 5,491.5 million, the latest central bank data showed.
“They will be given 8 lakhs per month as an income according to the currency of the country and the age category of the female caregiver is between the age of 25- 40,” the official said.

Women have more opportunities as caretakers. The Israeli Government of Israel has said that the country is ready to give opportunities to up to 8000 qualified workers on an annual basis.(Colombo/Feb17/2023)
